column4: How can I enable HDMI sound through my NVIDIA GTX 460? It is not in system=>prefs=>sound. Refer http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1560288&highlight=hdmi+sound+gtx+460
My System=>Preferences=>Sound does not have an option to choose HDMI
Plus, this is a NVIDIA Card
does not come up in aplay -l
oh ok. Hmm, not sure ... I'll keep pokin around
You know what it might be? ALSA is out of date and doesn't have support for the GTX 460
what's the plan of action? just wait until alsa supports this? i far as I can tell they do not but I can't find a list anywhere
yeah that might be your only option. Unless you pick up a card a bit older with support
well i can still do spdif
i will just have to wait for hdmi out which will include bitstreaming. you think it would be easy to pass unmolested audio through a card to a receiver.
i can barely find anything on this online
good question. I've never tried that before but I would think it should be fine
